solution.text:
Radius of cylinder = _{{20*k}}_ cm
\(\Rightarrow\) Since Volume is constant, Radius of cylinder and height are inversely proportional.
\(\Rightarrow\) Pi \(\times\) \({{Radius}}^2\) \(\times\) Height = Volume = k. Therefore \(({r}^2) \times h \)= K [Pi is a constant]
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore, taking case 1, \(({ 10 \times _{k}_ )^2} \times ( 40 \times _{j}_ )\)= K
\(\Rightarrow\) Hence, K= \( 4000 \times _{j}_ \times ({_{k}_}^2)\)
\(\Rightarrow\) If Height= _{{10*j}}_
\(\Rightarrow {Radius}^2 = K \div height\)
\(\Rightarrow {Radius}^2= 4000 \times _{j}_ \times \frac {{_{k}_}^2}{10 \times _{j}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow {Radius}^2 = 400 \times ({_{k}_}^2)\)
\(\Rightarrow {Radius}^2= {( 20 \times _{k}_)}^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius = _{{20*k}}_

content.text: The volume of a given right angle solid cylinder is constant. If the height of the cylinder is _{{40*j}}_ and Radius is _{{10*k}}_ cm. Find the radius of the cylinder when the height is _{{10*j}}_
